title: Any way to watch spectator mode replays of LCS-level games?
body: While the usual recorded replays are available, they don't reveal all of the less exciting points of information that are created over the course of a game. If only a viewer could move the screen around themselves, they could collect potentially useful metrics on - for instance - proportion of skillshots hit and dodged during lane phase. On top of that, being able to get at specific health values and smite timers would help a lot with all of the ballparking surrounding jungle metrics right now. Is there some way to get at these replays, whether through the use of a third-party program or otherwise, or do they not yet exist?

replies.body:
Hi Gramm

Unfortunately, there is no spectate option to watch LCS games

The only thing you can do is watch recorded games from lol esports YouTube channel

Hope this explains it :)

As far as I'm aware, replays (in the file sense) aren't available outside of the VODS you'll find on the [**LoL eSports site**](http://www.lolesports.com/).

If you'd like to suggest some way for this to happen in the future, especially now that the new client has a replay feature built-in, I recommend drafting a post for the [**Miscellaneous Boards**](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous). Let me know if you have any questions.
Alright. It's a shame, but thanks for your reply.
